name: Queen's Career Quiz / Test | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: In his early adventures, Green Arrow had an Arrowcave and an arrow-themed vehicle. Which other DC superhero was this imitating?
questions.explanation:
Batman.

	Batman has a Batcave, a Batmobile, a Batcopter and many more bat-themed items. Strangely enough, the Arrowcave no longer appears in Green Arrow's monthly comic book.

questions.text: Politics plays a major part in "Green Arrow". By the way, what are Oliver Queen's political leanings?
questions.explanation:
He's a liberal.

	It was thought for years that the long-standing feud between liberal Green Arrow and conservative Hawkman was due to their political stances, but readers of the 2004 miniseries "Identity Crisis" know the real reason why!

questions.text: As so many superheroes do, Green Arrow originally had a sidekick. What was his codename and his real name?
questions.explanation:
Speedy, Roy Harper.

	Roy has had a long career under a variety of names. He has broken his addiction to heroin and has also gone by the name of Arsenal. He most often is affiliated with the Titans.

questions.text: Oliver Queen is a prolific ladies' man. Which fellow crimefighter has he been romantically linked with?
questions.explanation:
Dinah Lance.

	Dinah Lance is also known as the Black Canary. Despite Queen's wandering eye, he always comes back to Dinah, his "pretty bird". Although Queen once came close to proposing, they're usually an on and off couple.

questions.text: With which other DC superhero did Green Arrow share a feature with in the 1970's?
questions.explanation:
Green Lantern.

	The short-lived series departed from the stereotypical superhero feature and instead dealt with social and political issues. In one issue, Roy Harper revealed he was addicted to heroin.

questions.text: In the miniseries "The Longbow Hunters", what did Green Arrow do for the first time?
options: Robbed from the rich and gave to a poor family
questions.explanation:
Intentionally killed someone.

	Green Arrow shot and killed a robber that would've murdered Dinah Lance. Enraged, Green Arrow didn't stop at merely disarming the man. This marked the first time Green Arrow killed someone on purpose, but it certainly wouldn't be the last time.

questions.text: Green Arrow also had a costume change during "The Longbow Hunters". What changed?
questions.correct: He added a hood and long sleeves
options: He added several holsters to his costume
questions.explanation:
He added a hood and long sleeves.

	Where Green Arrow had previously sported bare arms and a Robin Hood-esque hat, he wore a hood and long sleeves during his stint in Seattle, where "The Longbow Hunters" take place. Dinah Lance explained this was because of Seattle's colder climate.

questions.text: Oliver Queen was killed off in 1995. How did he die?
options: He cut himself with a knife
questions.explanation:
He triggered an explosion.

	Green Arrow sacrificed himself to detonate a bomb on a plane. The explosion would have destroyed Metropolis had Green Arrow not triggered it in the air. Luckily Hal Jordan, Green Arrow's old friend and the current Spectre, used his powers to bring him back to life in 2000.

questions.text: Who assumed the mantle of Green Arrow while Oliver Queen was dead?
questions.explanation:
Connor Hawke.

	It was revealed that due to one of Queen's various love affairs, he had an illegitimate son that was raised in seclusion named Connor Hawke. Hawke was a more softspoken Green Arrow, and now that Oliver is back, he and Connor share the mantle.

questions.text: Green Arrow got a new sidekick in 2005. What is this person's real name?
questions.explanation:
Mia Dearden.

	Mia Dearden is a former street urchin who was adopted by Oliver Queen shortly after the "Quiver" storyline, which marked Oliver Queen's official return to the living.  Mia has revealed that she is HIV-positive. She continues to lead a normal life and has joined the Teen Titans.
